name: The IdentityAccessManager Module
title: The IdentityAccessManager Module
body:
Overview

The module IdentityAccessManager will delegate the authentication for EFS Admin and Portals to Okta.
It handles all authentication interaction by following the OpenID Connect protocol with Okta and uses the Okta API to sync users and manage Portal instances at Okta.

Configuration options

Option

Description

Required (for working module)

Value Type

Default Value

iam_admin_bypass_login_route

A route which can be used by the root user or other system administrators to bypass the Okta login and sign in to EFS directly (like without Questback Access).

Changing this value will change the route for the installation.

❌

string

/iam/admin/auth/login/bypass

iam_api_token

The API token for Okta. This is used to access the user API (for syncing users), the application API and the trusted origins API (for syncing portal instances).

This token is created and can be retrieved in Okta during the setup of Questback Access

✅

string

''

iam_audience

The audience is a term defined in the OpenID Connect specification, which describes the targeted audience for a token (JWT).

This value is used to validate that a token was issued for this user + application.

The value can be taken from Okta (API > Authorization Servers) and is created during the setup of Questback Access

✅

string

api://questback

After Fix IN 19.5Red

iam_client_group_id

The client group ID is used to assign users to this group as well as assign portals applications to that group. This is a necessary performance improvement that scopes applications and users of this installation to exactly match the configured group.

This parameter has to be set and is crucial for Questback Access to work.

The value can be taken from the group that has to be created in Okta.

✅

string

00g1okh3pys1KeQPp416

iam_client_id

The application id of this specific EFS installation in Okta used for the OpenID Connect protocol.

This id is created during the setup of Questback Access and can be viewed in Okta (Applications)

✅

string

''

iam_client_secret

The secret for the application in Okta. Is in pair with the client id and is used to verify this application when retrieving tokens from Okta.

This secret is created during the setup of Questback Access and can be viewed in Okta (Applications)

✅

string

''

After Fix IN 19.5Red

iam_federated_domains

A list of domains which which should be synced as federated to Okta.

E.g: questback.com

❌

(This should match the Identity Provider routing rule in Okta for this tenant)

array

empty array

iam_idp_id

The Okta ID of an Identity Provider.

If set all users will be directly redirected to the configured Identity Provider and skip the login page from Okta.

This is used to enhance the user experience (e.g: Hiding questback and just showing the customers CI)

If internal admins need to login and this is activated, use the bypass route (see iam_admin_bypass_login_route)

❌

string

''

iam_module_active

This toggle controls if the module is active and the authentication is delegated to Okta.

Only toggle this on if the rest of the configuration is checked

Caution: If toggled off, the default EFS login well be used again, but disabling the module could have side effects

✅

boolean

false

iam_panelist_sync

Used to control how panelists are synced to Okta. The following values are selectable:

  • Deactivated - Panelists are not synced to Okta

  • Panelist Sync - Panelists are synced to Okta but not activated

  • Panelist Sync and Activation - Panelists are synced and activated

✅

enum

Deactivated

iam_post_logout_redirect_url

Alternative Redirect URL after successful logout in IdP

Default redirect is back to the login page

For the built in post logout page for Questback Access use:
{scheme}://{installation-domain}/iam/admin/auth/logoutSuccess
e.g: http://iam-demo.qb-feedback.com/iam/admin/auth/logoutSuccess

❌

string

''

iam_proxy_url

This field is used to configure a proxy for communications between EFS and Okta

✅

(if a proxy is used)

string

''

iam_redirect_url

A configuration for OpenID Connect. This specifies to which URL the user should be redirected to after authentication. This will be the used installation alias + the path /iam/admin/auth/login

This has to match one of the Okta configured redirect URLs for this application id.

✅

string

''

iam_show_error_as_json

This option changes activates the output of error messages in JSON format. This is mostly used for debugging purposes

❌

boolean

false

iam_sso_modules

Set the modules which are enabled for Questback Access.
Possible values are:

  • efs (required for Questback Access)

  • portal (required for Portals and Panelist sync)

❌

(depends on the tenants setup/use case)

array

[efs]

iam_support_email

An email address which is shown on error pages for the user to contact support.

✅

string

support@questback.com

iam_unique_customer_name

Used for naming resources in Okta (e.g: Syncing portal apps to Okta).

This should be a short and unique name of the tenant (e.g: questback).

see Naming conventions in Okta

✅

string

''

iam_user_group_id

The ID of the group in Okta for this tenant.

This is used to assign all synced users to a group so Okta policies can be scoped on said user groups.

If this is not set, user creation (and similar) may show warnings/errors that users were not synced

This must not be the group ID of the group “Everyone” in Okta!

✅

string

''

iam_well_known_url

The URL of the discovery document for the custom authorization server in Okta.

This contains all non-application specific settings for Okta and is used to process the authentication response from Okta and sending unauthenticated users to Okta.

This can be taken from Okta (API > Authorization Servers) and is created during the setup of Questback Access

✅

string

''
